image.altText: Two men in dark suits and blue ties walk down North Terrace.

props.synopsis: Billions of dollars are being spent on early childhood education, skills and training, and infrastructure projects, but for many voters, current challenges like the rising cost of living and the housing shortage are likely to be at the forefront of their minds. So, has the latest budget done enough to address the state's problems?

title.children: SA premier looks to the 2030s, but does his latest budget do enough to address current problems?

image.altText: Players grapple with each other in roller derby training at Lightsview

props.synopsis: The roller derby is coming to town and it ain't pretty.

title.children: It's a sport where physical clashes are all the go and it takes a toll on bodies

image.altText: Louise Goode shouts as her former house is demolished behind her.

props.synopsis: Louise Goode's fight for the place of "emotional comfort" she called home lasted a quarter of a century, until it was demolished in front of her as she screamed for help.

title.children: 'Stop, please!': The moment a demolition crew ended this forgotten Australian's 25-year fight for her home

image.altText: Andrew Giles in his office.

props.synopsis: The immigration minister has issued a new directive he says will make it "clearer" that non-citizens with a history of family or sexual violence should be deported, even if they have lived most of their lives in Australia.

title.children: Andrew Giles issues replacement to 'direction 99' which he says prioritises community safety

image.altText: Former retail worker Hannah sits on the beach

props.synopsis: Retail workers are told "the customer is always right" but when they're dealing with leering, stalking and intrusive questions, a new study has found there are few places to turn for support.

title.children: From the awkward to the 'really scary', sexual harassment is 'just another day in retail' for staff, according to study

image.altText: Aerial shot of dozens of houses in neat rows in a new outer-suburban housing estate.

props.synopsis: Industry experts say it's not time to ring the alarm bells over low building approval numbers, but the federal government's plan for 1.2 million homes by 2029 is definitely ambitious.

title.children: The latest building stats are in — here's what they say about the future of the housing crisis

image.altText: AFL footballer celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Adem Yze's young Tigers have found their roar once more, travelling to Adelaide on a five-day back-up to down the Crows by eight points in a thriller.

title.children: Tigers upset Crows in thrilling clash to record second win of the season in emphatic fashion

image.altText: White, yellow and red curly fungi.

props.synopsis: Fungi enthusiasts in SA's South East say there's a lot of interest in this year's season, despite recent cases of suspected mushroom poisonings.

title.children: As late fungi season blooms in mushroom 'paradise', foragers are urged to be wary

image.altText: A man wearing a blue cap, polo shirt, cargo shorts and sunglasses opens his backpack on a beach

props.synopsis: British TV doctor Michael Mosley has been reported missing after going on a coastal walk alone on the Greek island of Symi.

title.children: Michael Mosley, TV doctor who popularised intermittent fasting, missing on Greek island

image.altText: A pink pig, backlit, looks straight on at the camera, which is zoomed in on its face.

props.synopsis: The average American farmer doesn't fix fences and drive tractors. Thanks to market concentration, there is now a handful of companies that dominate the US food system, and they are impacting Australia too.

title.children: Meet the six mega-rich families running the food system

image.altText: Anthony Albanese at a press conference at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese says his cabinet is preparing "an offer" to put to the Australian people at the election. As it crafts its pitch, the biggest uncertainty is what sort of parliament a second term Labor government would likely face.

title.children: A minority government or President Trump: Uncertainty looms over Labor's promises to voters

image.altText: King Charles reaches out from under a black umbrella canopy to wave at a crowd.

props.synopsis: The King's Birthday celebrations are happening this weekend. Here's a state-by-state breakdown of when you'll get a day off.

title.children: Millions of Australians have an extra day off next week. But it depends on where you live

image.altText: A boy looks amid grey rubble

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says Hamas militants were operating from within the Nuseirat school, while witnesses recount chaotic scenes as the injured are rushed to nearby hospitals.

title.children: Israeli strike kills at least 40 people at Gaza school that military claims was being used by Hamas

image.altText: Joe Biden speaks at a podium in front of American flags.

props.synopsis: Two things Donald Trump loves to talk about are America's border crisis and Joe Biden's son. Both are now making news in the US, just days after the former president's criminal conviction dominated the headlines.

title.children: Biden tries to flip the political narrative, as his family deals with a personal drama

image.altText: A row of tents in front of a long building at the Australian National University campus.

props.synopsis: ANU vice-chancellor Genevieve Bell tells a Senate estimates hearing that two students connected to pro-Palestinian protests on campus have been expelled, and are among 10 disciplinary actions launched since the protest began.

title.children: Disciplinary action taken against 10 students since ANU pro-Palestine encampment began, Senate estimates hears

image.altText: Four European Union flags fly outside a large tall corporate building on a dark and stormy day.

props.synopsis: The European Central Bank cut interest rates for the first time in five years after its inflation outlook improved, but warned that it's not "pre-committing to a particular rate path" for future decisions. Follow live.

title.children: European Central Bank joins Canada in cutting interest rates, but not 'pre-committing' to further moves

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: SkyCity fined $67 million for breaching anti-money laundering laws
ASX rises as gains by miners offset drops in tech and energy
📺 Why central banks can't claim victory over inflation just yet

image.altText: Two SES team members in flood waters

props.synopsis: The NSW State Emergency Services has carried out almost 50 flood rescues overnight as parts of the Illawarra and Sydney were drenched with more than 200 millimetres of rain.

title.children: 'Copped an absolute flogging': Dozens of rescues as Sydney, Illawarra smashed by heavy rain

image.altText: Greg Lynn court sketch - profile

props.synopsis: Lawyers for both the prosecution and the defence questioned Mr Lynn for hours on Thursday about the events surrounding the deaths of campers Russell Hill and Carol Clay.

title.children: The five biggest moments in Greg Lynn's testimony in the Victorian campers murder trial

image.altText: Punnets of blueberries for sale

props.synopsis: The price of blueberries has soared around the nation, and strawberry prices look set to follow.

title.children: Blueberry prices surge, but would you spend $20 on a punnet?

image.altText: Lightning and storm clouds over a town, lit up at night. There are three forks of lightning lighting the grey cloudy sky.

props.synopsis: A new industry is selling its services in Australia — weather forecasting using artificial intelligence and offering precise, hour-by-hour forecasts for areas as small as a football field.

title.children: AI weather startups claiming to be more accurate than the BOM on the rise

image.altText: A photo of Steve Bannon sitting at a table in court. He has shoulder length greying hair.

props.synopsis: Steve Bannon, a former top adviser to Donald Trump, must report to prison by July 1 to serve a four-month sentence for contempt of US Congress, a federal judge has ruled.

title.children: Ex-Trump aide Steve Bannon ordered to report to prison for contempt sentence

image.altText: Jasmine Paolini

props.synopsis: Jasmine Paolini sees off Russian teen Mirra Andreeva to book a spot in the women's French Open final against Iga Swiatek.

title.children: 'It seems impossible': Italian bolter secures unlikely French Open final spot against rampaging Swiatek

image.altText: Socceroos

props.synopsis: Socceroos coach Graham Arnold hits out at the "dangerous" pitch as Australia defeats Bangladesh 2-0 in a World Cup qualifier.

title.children: 'It's unacceptable': Arnold blasts dangerous pitch as Socceroos see off Bangladesh in World Cup qualifier

image.altText: A woman smiles as she holds an Australian flag.

props.synopsis: Nina Kennedy shared World Championship gold with American Katie Moon last year. She is hoping to become Australia's first female pole vault Olympic gold medallist.

title.children: 'All your eggs in one basket': World Champion Nina Kennedy has her eyes set on Olympic gold

image.altText: Selwyn Cobbo high-fives Queensland Maroons teammate Hamiso Tabuai-Fidow during State of Origin I.

props.synopsis: Are you across this week's news headlines? Put yourself to the test.

title.children: Weekly news quiz: State of Origin, very expensive Tim Tams, and gravity-defying animals

image.altText: Four older women chat over cups of tea with sandwiches on a table in front of them and ANZAC posters framed behind them.

props.synopsis: The number of Australians waiting for a home care package has increased to more than 68,000, with departmental officials conceding it is becoming harder to access the scheme.

title.children: More older Australians are wanting home care packages but are waiting longer for support

image.altText: F1 reserve driver Jack Doohan during the launch of the Alpine F1 car, wearing a racing suit with no helmet

props.synopsis: Alpine has called up Australian racing driver Jack Doohan to complete the first practice session this weekend in Montréal.

title.children: Son of Aussie racing legend gets first audition for vacant F1 seat

image.altText: An image of an industrial vehicle and a utility vehicle.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide man is arrested after police allege they found stolen items, including 20 shipping containers, horse buggies, four-wheel drives and numerous trucks at his property.

title.children: Police allege huge cache of stolen items, including shipping containers, 4wds and trucks, found at Adelaide man's home

image.altText: A man in blue top outside a court building. A woman looks on behind him

props.synopsis: Sang Van Huynh has pleaded guilty to two counts of causing serious harm by dangerous driving following a crash which injured two Marryatville High School students in Adelaide's eastern suburbs last year.

title.children: Truck driver changes plea to guilty over crash which injured two high school students

image.altText: A bald man in a police uniform stands in front of a police background.

props.synopsis: This week, Lois Witt became the seventh woman in Queensland to be violently killed by a man so far this year.

title.children: Queensland's new police commissioner says women are right to feel rage over gendered violence rates

image.altText: Vasa Selupe smiles while standing in front of some trees.

props.synopsis: The first Pacific Engagement Visas will be granted in late 2024. Experts and community leaders welcome the scheme, but say the government needs to manage it carefully.

title.children: A new Pacific visa is expected to be a hit — but some warn it could bring challenges for the region

image.altText: Ellie Carpenter has the ball between her legs with Lauren Hemp running behind her

props.synopsis: From 2026, women's football for club and country will look different. So, what exactly has FIFA done, and will it help grow the game?

title.children: Will FIFA's new match calendar help or hurt the women's game?

image.altText: First-person perspective from man lying on the ground with a man in a suit looming over him.

props.synopsis: Nine Entertainment chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting a journalist at Canberra Airport after The Australian posted footage that appears to show Mr Costello walking towards reporter Liam Mendes, who was asking him questions, before Mr Mendes falls backwards.

title.children: Nine chairman Peter Costello denies assaulting journalist at Canberra Airport

image.altText: An elderly couple sitting together, John wearing a green blazer and Terry in burgundy

props.synopsis: On Thursday, NSW became the last state to issue a formal apology on behalf of the government to people convicted of homosexual acts for laws and policies that "criminalised, persecuted and harmed" the LGBTQI+ community.

title.children: Terry lost his job in the 60s after historic laws targeted men like him, but now feels 'validated'

image.altText: Marcia Neave portrait smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: Marcia Neave led the nation's first-ever royal commission into family violence. She has since labelled the government's response to reform as "simplistic".

title.children: After hearing some of the darkest stories involving the deaths of Victorian women, Marcia Neave says there's more to be done
